text:
Raskolnikov entered the clean restaurant. 

“Have you the papers?” he asked the waiter. 

“Here’s today’s. No vodka?” 

“Just tea and the old ones.” 

Raskolnikov scanned the papers. 

“Damn… accidents, fires,” he muttered. 

Then he found it. 

His hands shook as he read. 

Suddenly, someone sat beside him. 

It was Zametov, the head clerk. 

“Hello,” Zametov said, smiling. 

Raskolnikov looked up, startled.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, in a restaurant, anxiously searches through old newspapers for specific news while observing the people around him.
